title: Album Page, "Tile Floor, Diane de Poitiers Bedroom, Château de Chaumont", June 12, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphtie on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 50; bottom right corner: 43; below drawing at lower right (written on ruled lines): Tile Floor in Diane de Poitiers Bedroom / Chateau de Chaumont / Echelle 1/8 execution; June 12th 1888; above drawings of tiles: 1. / 2. / 3. / 4. / 5. / 6. / 7. / 8.  Previously written but erased, below right (written on ruled lines): May 12th 1888.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating plan view of a tiled floor with patterns of tiles in blue, white, yellow, and brick-red (in imitation of terra cotta).  Above this are drawings of each of the eight different types of tiles. They include, from left to right: a blue fleur-de-lys on white ground; two of the letter D interlocked in blue on a white ground with blue corners; a version of the previous tile but only on a white ground with the letters rendered in golden yellow; a yellow Tudor rose with black center on a blue ground; three interlaced blue crescent moons (Borromean rings) with small yellow stars on white ground; one example each of a blue, brick red, and orange red tile.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Tile Floor, Diane de Poitiers Bedroom, Château de Chaumont", June 12, 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphtie on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-216.
